issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

fields.description:
Given a C++ std::shared_ptr<RecordBatch>, retrieve it in java as a VectorSchemaRoot class. Gandiva already offer a similar facility but with raw buffers. It would be convenient if users could call C++ that yields RecordBatch and retrieve it in a seamless fashion.

This would remove one roadblock of using C++ dataset facility in Java.
fields.summary: [C++][Java][Dataset] JNI bridge between RecordBatch and VectorSchemaRoot

comments.body: The C data interface should be the preferred way to achieve this. It requires implementing on the Java side, though.

bq. The C data interface should be the preferred way to achieve this. It requires implementing on the Java side, though.

Should it be? Why not use flatbuffer since that is already supported on both sides of the boundary?
Assuming flatbuffers can be messaged to handle buffer lifetimes properly, why not.
Let's limit the scope of changes into dataset module since we don't yet have a common module for jni utilities.
